item.title: Document
item.description: Document Requirement In order to run NKind, the following software are necessary to be installed in the system: Java 11 or later Z3 Usage NKind is used in command line environment by specifying the Lustre input. 1 nkind example.lus Arguments list below can also be specified to control the operation: --max-round <INTEGER> set the max unroll length in BMC. --timeout <INTEGER> set the verification timeout, and UNKNOWN will be returned if timeout threshold is reached.

item.title: Main
item.description: Introduction NKind is an SMT-based infinite-state model checking tool, which is mainly used for proving or disproving properties of synchronous reactive system models written in Lustre. NKind mainly relies on te powerful SMT-solver Z3 to validate or invalidate the properties. For properties that are proved to be invalid, a counterexample will be returned. Apart from the traditional verification for safety properties, NKind supports liveness properties as well, bridging the gap in liveness property checking in Lustre.
